description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Moments in Antalya" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Moments in Antalya

places.generalDescription: Duden Waterfalls is a natural wonder located in a park, featuring upper waterfalls of a partly underground river that cascade in front of a cave. The site offers an opportunity for outdoor adventures and sightseeing, making it an ideal destination for nature enthusiasts and history buffs alike. With its picturesque surroundings and historical significance, Duden Waterfalls is a must-visit attraction on the Mediterranean coast of Turkey.

sources.snippet: Wenn Sie an die Mittelmeerk√ºste der T√ºrkei reisen, sollten Sie sich auf die tiefen Blaut√∂ne und die Atmosph√§re des Ozeans einstellen. Die meisten Menschen w√ºrden jedoch nicht in Betracht ziehen, eine der √ºppigsten Landschaften des Antalya-Duden-Wasserfalls zu besuchen. W√§hlen Sie zwischen Oberer D√ºden oder Unterer D√ºden, beide Wasserf√§lle pr√§sentieren wundersch√∂ne Wasserf√§lle im Hintergrund, um jede Instagram Antalya-Haltung zu verbessern, an die Sie denken.
sources.shortName: Die 12 besten Instagram Hotspots in Antalya 2022

sources.snippet: D√ºden waterfalls are remarkably beautiful waterfalls located on the coast of downtown Antalya. This picturesque site is the city's first attraction that welcomes you as your plane descends at Antalya airport.
sources.shortName: The Best Attractions and Things To Do in Antalya

sources.snippet: Choose from the Upper Duden or Lower Duden, both waterfalls cascade beautifully in the background to enhance any Instagram Antalya pose you‚Äôre thinking about.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Antalya
The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Antalya

places.name: Duden Waterfalls

reviews.text: D√ºden Waterfall is a beautiful spot well worth a visit while in Antalya! There's a convenient autopark right at the entrance for just 20 TL, which made access super easy. Entry prices vary for locals and foreigners, which might catch some off guard, but it's understandable and helps keep sites like this affordable for residents. The waterfall itself is stunning, with lush greenery and a peaceful atmosphere. One of the highlights is the cave that runs behind the waterfall. It's such a unique experience to walk through and see the water cascading from behind. However, if you're tall or have mobility issues, be cautious. The cave has some low ceilings and uneven steps that can be tricky. Still, it's an amazing natural site that's definitely worth checking out. Whether you're a local or a visitor, it's a relaxing and memorable way to spend an afternoon.

One of the best waterfalls in this area. There is a car park in front of the entry point. Parking and entry tickets are not expensive.
You need to walk a bit from the entrance to reach the falls, please mind your head as some places rocks are very low. Caverns are worth going into for going behind the falls but mind there is some water dripping there.
There are gift shops, souvenir, restaurants available. Good place to spend a couple of hours.

The entrance fee is very affordable, only around 2-3 euros per person, and it's worth every cent! The scenery is absolutely stunning ‚Äì if you're a nature lover, you will enjoy it to the fullest. Lush greenery surrounds the powerful waterfalls, creating a refreshing and relaxing atmosphere.
There are small shops selling souvenirs, ice creams, and slushies, as well as local ladies preparing traditional Turkish treats on the spot ‚Äì perfect for a quick taste of local flavors before or after your walk.
Overall, a must-visit spot if you love being close to nature.

places.address: Varsak Mahallesi D√ºden ≈ûelalesi Parkƒ± i√ßi, Kepez/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the eastern outskirts of Antalya, the Lower Duden Waterfalls are a stunning natural wonder that gracefully tumble into the Mediterranean Sea. Originating from the Duden River, which flows down from the Taurus Mountains, these waterfalls create a breathtaking spectacle as they cascade over cliffs surrounded by lush greenery. This picturesque destination is particularly enchanting in spring when water flow is at its peak, but it remains a captivating sight year-round.

sources.snippet: Just like the Upper D√ºden Waterfall, the Lower D√ºden Waterfall also offers spectacular backdrops for Instagram selfies. The natural beauty of this place is simply irresistible and will take your Instagram pictures to a new level. Don't miss the opportunity to take some impressive photos here!
sources.shortName: Antalya's Top 12 Instagram Hotspots: Capture the Beauty of Turkey 2024

places.name: Lower Duden Waterfalls

reviews.text:
Great little park, fast flowing river, bridges, lots of benches and tables, green spaces.  You can be 2m from the roaring water.  It's no Niagara Falls but it's pretty decent.  Gorgeous high rock cliffs, sea and clean blue water.  Go on a nice weather, sunny day though, winds can be severe.  Nice stone paths around the edge, plenty of viewpoints.  Vendors selling stuff and cafes.  WC in large building (no signs, but it's the biggest building there, in the center).  Continue walking around the cliff path, parks, playgrounds, more viewpoints. All good stuff.  And it's free!

Easy bus ride from town center (KL08), takes ~40mins (packed in town, easy to find seat out of town).

A green park with plenty of space to relax and chill out. You can drink coffee/tea eat something sweet. On-site restroom facilities. The biggest attraction is the waterfall, where fresh water mixes with salt water. An attraction worth seeing. The view is spectacular.
You can also buy a boat trip from the port and admire the waterfall from the sea.

A beautiful spot to come and see some amazing views where the river meets the med sea. Lots of places to sit, WiFi access. Grab a coffee, or a snack and take in the delights. This is probably one of my favourite places I visited in Antalya, and at 40¬∞c....it was a magical place ‚ú®Ô∏è ‚ù§Ô∏è

places.generalDescription: Karaalioglu Park is a picturesque urban green space in Antalya, offering stunning sea views and the ruins of a Roman stone tower. Situated near the old town of Kaleici, it provides a tranquil retreat with elements of nature beautifully presented. The park features tall trees, palm trees, flowers, and spacious areas with benches for relaxation. It's a popular spot for locals seeking fresh air on hot summer days.

sources.snippet: Karaalioglu Park in Antalya is a hidden gem that shouldn't be missing from your Instagram profile. This lush green park not only offers a relaxing oasis in the middle of the city, but also plenty of Instagram-worthy motifs. From statues and sculptures to breathtaking viewpoints over the Mediterranean, this park offers a wealth of photo opportunities.
sources.shortName: Antalya's Top 12 Instagram Hotspots: Capture the Beauty of Turkey 2024

sources.snippet: When you think of Turkey you might not think of lush green parks, but Karaalioglu Park is home to numerous statues, viewpoints, and remarkable views that will make your followers jealous of your Antalya Instagram posts.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Antalya
The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Antalya

places.name: Karaalioglu Park

reviews.text:
In the Green Haven of Karaalioƒülu Park, Antalya

Antalya is home to many parks, but Karaalioƒülu Parkƒ± stands out for its vast size and well-preserved nature. This is my second visit since settling in Antalya for a month. The park left a lasting impression the first time, but today, it feels especially lush and vibrant.

The sky was clear, and the trees were full of life. The Mediterranean shimmered in transparent hues, and the distant Olympos Mountain stood majestically like a painting. The park exuded an air of serenity. Many locals sat perched on the rocky outcrops, gazing at the sea, lost in thought. Some sat in silence, deep in contemplation, while others exchanged quiet conversations in hushed tones.

On the way to the park, the weekend market added to the charm of the stroll. From cheese and honey to an array of colorful Turkish desserts, the market was brimming with delicacies. The sweet aroma of treats wafted through the air as locals skillfully selected their desired goods with familiarity and care. Simply walking through the lively market, taking in the sights and scents, made the experience even more delightful.

The walking paths here are filled with peace and happiness. It's a place where one can step away from the demands of daily life and reconnect with oneself. Breathing in the fresh air, I am reminded of the beauty in life's simple pleasures. Today, Karaalioƒülu Parkƒ± has gifted me a truly special moment.

Nice place. A bit crowded on weekends. There are lots of caf√©s where you can enjoy coffee or tea with a sea view. In the park, you'll find plenty of cats. If you're not a fan of them, better stay away-this place truly belongs to the cats!

A quiet area with lots of free space to relax and enjoy the surroundings. It's close to the harbour and beaches, making it perfect for a peaceful stroll. You'll see plenty of friendly cats around, which adds to the charm.

The presence of police gives a sense of safety, and there are a couple of nice restaurants nearby if you get hungry.

places.generalDescription: Hadrian's Gate is a significant historical site in Antalya, Turkey. It is a Roman triumphal arch built in 130 AD to commemorate Emperor Hadrian's visit to Attaleia. The gate consists of three identical marble, granite, and stone archways standing 8m tall and is considered the most beautiful in Pamphylia. It bears marks and additions from various civilizations that followed Hadrian. The two towers flanking the entrance are from different time periods.

sources.snippet: Hadrian‚Äôs Gate is one of the main (and the most dramatic) entrance gates into the Kalei√ßi district. Considerable stretches of the Hellenistic and Roman town walls on the eastern side of the old town have been preserved, and Hadrian‚Äôs Gate is the most notable of these sections. Erected in honor of the AD 130 visit by Emperor Hadrian himself, this imposing three-arched marble gateway, flanked by imposing towers, is decorated with rich sculptural decorations.
sources.shortName: 7 Top Tourist Attractions of Antalya Which You Shouldn't Miss 2025

sources.snippet: Hadrian‚Äôs Gate (√ú√ßkapƒ±lar, meaning ‚ÄúThe Three Gates‚Äù) is a triumphal arch located in Antalya, Turkey, which was built in the name of the  Roman emperor Hadrian, who visited the city in the year 130. It is the only remaining entrance gate in the walls that surround the city and harbor. Hadrian‚Äôs Gate is One of the most important monumental Antalya tourist attractions, this gate was once used as the main entrance to the Kaleici town.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Photo Spots in Antalya

sources.snippet: Hadrian's Gate in Antalya is not only an architectural masterpiece but also an Instagram must-see!. If you've been to Antalya and don't have a photo of Hadrian's Gate on your Instagram account, then you really weren't there. This hotspot is an absolute must for anyone who wants to experience the beauty and history of this city.
sources.shortName: Antalya's Top 12 Instagram Hotspots: Capture the Beauty of Turkey 2024

sources.snippet: Built in honor of Emperor Hadrian, Hadrian‚Äôs Gate welcomes provides a dramatic way for visitors to enter the Kaleici. It is one of the few preserved remains of Roman and Hellenistic town halls on the eastern side of the old town. Look towards the ceiling to see the best sculptural carvings.
sources.shortName: 23 Fabulous Things to Do in Antalya, Turkey, Including The Best Day Trips!

sources.snippet: Staying in Kalei√ßi, Hadrian‚Äôs Gate is the only remaining entrance gate in the walls that surround the old city. Built-in Roman times it‚Äôs super impressive with so much history. Don‚Äôt forget to head to the bottom of the main arch for pictures as well as have it in the background!.
sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable places in Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.name: Hadrian's Gate

reviews.text: Nice place. Remnants of the Roman influence on this part of the world. Made in typical Roman architecture, the pillars stand testimony to their building skills and the fact that still exist in great condition despite the humidity and salty air in Antalya is testimony to their prowess. Great place to take photos and videos. Saw a lot of people also doing li e streams here.

If you are in the area, worth viewing. I wouldn't recommend driving a long distance to go view. These photos are all there is to see in my opinion. Too many modern architecture surrounding it. Old meets new.

Old town is beautiful. Reminds me of a lot of European old towns. Because a lot of them were under Ottoman empire back in the days.  Recommending to visit morning or evening because of the afternoon heat. üòÅ

places.address: Barbaros, Atat√ºrk Cd, Hadrian Kale Kapƒ±sƒ±, 07100 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Yivliminare Mosque, also known as the Fluted Minaret, is a 13th-century place of worship located in Antalya. The mosque features six domes and a 38-meter-high minaret built by the Seljuk sultan Alaaddin Keykubat. The mosque was originally a Byzantine church and still displays remnants of an 800-year-old water channel under glass.

sources.shortName: Die 12 besten Instagram Hotspots in Antalya 2022

places.name: Yivliminare Mosque

reviews.text: A very historic mosque with a distinctive minaret that stands out both during the day and at night. One interesting feature is a section of old waterworks visible beneath a glass panel.
we came around 7am thinking it would be open already. unfortunately it was not. the security guard said it will open much later, too bad. so we only read the history from the poster outside

It was quite when I went there so it was super peaceful. Tourist are welcome and theres no tickets needed. They have headscarf and skirts for ladies to coverup before entering. I sat there for a while and loved it.

places.generalDescription: Antalya Kalei√ßi Ancient City & Marina is a charming maze of cobbled streets and narrow alleys, now home to boutique hotels, souvenir shops, art galleries, and restaurants. This ancient world atmosphere offers a lot of tourist attractions including a main square with a stone gate and clock tower. The Tekeli Muhammad Pasha mosque from the eighteenth century is worth visiting for its amazing designs and fragrant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: The picturesque boats in the harbor are reflected in the calm waters, while the historic buildings of the old town form an enchanting backdrop. Here you can develop your creativity and capture unique Instagram moments. Whether you're capturing the colorful boats, the sun-kissed cliffs, or the charming atmosphere, this location offers endless opportunities for stunning photos.
sources.shortName: Antalya's Top 12 Instagram Hotspots: Capture the Beauty of Turkey 2024

places.name: Antalya Kalei√ßi Ancient City & Marina

reviews.text:
Good afternoon out, the Rolex watches and other  designer goods are really cheap!!
Pleasant harbour and boat trips if you like that sort of thing. The old town is well worth a look

A Stunning Historic Gem by the Sea

Kalei√ßi Marina is absolutely magical! Nestled in the heart of Antalya's Old Town, this picturesque harbor is a perfect blend of history, charm, and coastal beauty. Surrounded by ancient city walls, colorful boats, and charming cafes, it feels like stepping into a Mediterranean postcard.

The views of the turquoise sea and rugged cliffs are breathtaking, especially at sunset. It's the perfect place to stroll, relax, or take a boat tour along the coast. The nearby shops and restaurants add to the lively, yet laid-back vibe.

A must-visit when in Antalya-romantic, scenic, and full of character. Five stars all the way!

Great place to visit. The boat riding was an amazing experience.
You will see beautiful sceneries during your boat trip.

places.generalDescription: Hidirlik Tower, a round stone structure dating back to the 2nd century CE, stands on the western edge of Antalya's old town amid the picturesque Karaalioglu park. Believed to have been part of the city's ancient fortifications, its original purpose remains a mystery, with theories ranging from a mausoleum to a watchtower or lighthouse for the bustling port below.

sources.snippet: The Hƒ±dƒ±rlƒ±k Tower, an imposing tower made of yellow-brown stone in Antalya, Turkey, is a real eye-catcher. The picturesque parks of Kalei√ßi and Karaalioglu are in the immediate vicinity. This tower is not only a striking landmark but also one of the most sought-after Instagram hotspots in Antalya.
sources.shortName: Antalya's Top 12 Instagram Hotspots: Capture the Beauty of Turkey 2024

sources.snippet: Hƒ±dƒ±rlƒ±k Tower is an ancient structure built in the 2nd century AD during the Roman era. Emperor Hadrian believed to have made this tower was used as a lighthouse and for defense purposes.
sources.shortName: The Best Attractions and Things To Do in Antalya

places.name: Hidirlik Tower

reviews.text: You can walk freely. It is a beautiful place for family or friends. You can also take a beautiful picture and eat something light there or meditate. I recommend visiting the site.

Hidirlik Tower is a great spot to check out, especially for the stunning views it offers over the sea and the surrounding area. Located near the old town, it's an easy stop while exploring the historic streets. There are some really good eateries nearby too, making it a nice place to take a break and enjoy the scenery. Not a ton to do at the tower itself, but the location and views make it well worth a visit.
Was visiting the place at night again..it's so beautiful to see the place with all the lights‚Ä¶ people sitting and enjoying the cooler temperatures‚Ä¶

places.address: Kƒ±lƒ±n√ßarslan, Hƒ±dƒ±rlƒ±k Sk. No:50, 07100 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Beach Park in Antalya offers a variety of stunning beaches with crystal blue waters. Olympos Beach is an exotic and preserved wild beach, while Alanya Portakal (Orange) Beach boasts a wide sandy stretch. Konyaalti Beach, near the city center, features a 350-meter sandy beach with exclusive private cabanas for a luxurious seaside experience. Oludeniz stands out as a favorite coastal destination with its breathtaking beauty and hidden adventures.

sources.snippet: Of all the beach and coastal destinations I went to, Oludeniz was my favourite. It‚Äôs absolutely stunning. Moreover, beyond the beach right adjacent to town, there are lots of hidden gems and adventures in the area.
sources.shortName: Best Places for Photography in Turkey

places.name: Beach Park, Antalya

reviews.text:
Antalya - one of the most beautiful places in T√ºrkiye. Love the landscape here.
Incredible beach with beautiful boardwalk with so many restaurants and cafes.
The mountain views in the distance are so dreamy.

The beaches at Beach Park are spectacular! It's a peaceful and well-equipped place. There are changing rooms, showers, restrooms, and restaurants. The beaches are clean, and I personally love that they have pebbles instead of sand. It's my favorite spot in Antalya. The mountains in the background add a magical and special touch to the scenery.

One of the best beach promenades I've been to. You can swim, fish, sun breathe. But also play different sports, there is everything from beach side shacks to high end cafes and beach clubs. There is running track, a cycling track and walking track. I walked nearly 10 kilometers back and forth and enjoyed my to the fullest. Amazing work done by the local authorities

places.generalDescription: Perge Ancient City, located just 18km north of Antalya, is a significant site in ancient Pamphylia. It has a rich history dating back to the Hittites around 1500 BCE and was inhabited continuously until the Byzantine era. The city was ruled by various powers including the Persians, Athenians, Alexander the Great, and the Romans.

sources.snippet: Perge‚Äôs vast and rubble-filled stadium, half-destroyed temples, and huge colonnaded agora are imbued with an atmosphere of past glory. This was once the capital of ancient Pamphylia, which blossomed under first Greek and then Roman rule. The ruins here, about 17 kilometers east of Antalya, are not as well-preserved as others on Turkey‚Äôs Turquoise Coast, but this also means they attract fewer crowds, leaving visitors able to explore the long colonnaded streets and half-collapsed temples in peace.
sources.shortName: 7 Top Tourist Attractions of Antalya Which You Shouldn't Miss 2025

sources.snippet: Only about 17 kilometers away from Antalya, Perge was the ancient capital city of Pamphylia under the rule of Rome and Greece. There are some temples, a stadium, and huge agoras that survive to today. Compared to other ancient sites, Perge is less popular and attracts fewer visitors, which makes it a great place to visit if you‚Äôre looking to escape the crowds and enjoy Perge‚Äôs more tranquil atmosphere.
sources.shortName: 23 Fabulous Things to Do in Antalya, Turkey, Including The Best Day Trips!

sources.snippet: Perge was originally an ancient Lycian settlement[b] that later became a Greek city in Pamphylia. It was the capital of the Roman province of Pamphylia Secunda, now located in Antalya. It was the birthplace of the Greek mathematician Apollonius of Perga, one of the most notable mathematicians of antiquity for his work on conic sections.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Photo Spots in Antalya

places.name: Perge Ancient City

reviews.text: Atmospheric place to discover old ruins of ancient Roman city. Touching the ruins gave me goosebumps because every stone is a history. I wandered around it for three whole hours. But that's a bummer that amphitheater was closed. Definitely worth to visit this place! Comfortable shoes recommended, and also bring your own water, as local museum shop is too expensive and it's very hot here. Entry ticket was ‚Ç¨11.

Really such a unique place. The scale of the site is phenomenal. The structures at times are massive. It's wonderful. The site is still under excavation, they'll find so so so much more under all the mounds and hills - how thrilling. They now charge a car parking fee of 30 tl plus the ‚Ç¨11 entrance fee. Minus one star because of two reasons: 1. No audio guide was available and what limited written information was available on-site is poorly written from a tourists' point of view. It was clearly written by an academic who assumes you know the function of each building, it needs to be less technical and more descriptive. An audio guide would have been great here. 2. A lot more needs to be done to preserve the ruins - you have people climbing all over them and exposed mosaics that people can walk on and very little is being done to prevent it. Also, there are collapsed fences, signs and excavation equipment all over the place - it needs a tidy up. Otherwise it's just wonderful, give yourself nearly 3 hours to see everything.

I would visit this place again in a heartbeat! This was my first experience with seeing ancient Roman architecture and I loved it!

I was a bit short on time, so I was only able to stay for about an hour and a half, but I could easily spend 3-4 hours here if I wasn't pressed for time.

sources.snippet: The beach is located on the west side of the city and stretches for 13 km primarily composed of fine pebbles and has some sand. The water is beautifully clear. Konyaaltƒ± Beach has ‚ÄúBlue Flag‚Äù status, which confirms the good water quality.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Photo Spots in Antalya

sources.snippet: Am Strand von Konyaalti gibt es viele Orte, die f√ºr Instagram geeignet sind, und ihre Hintergr√ºnde sind gro√üartig. Am beliebtesten ist der Hot Spot im Bilderrahmen am Anfang des Koynaalti Beach
sources.shortName: Die 12 besten Instagram Hotspots in Antalya 2022

sources.snippet: This 7-KM-long beach is one of the most extensive beaches in Turkey. Along the Konyaaltƒ± beach, there are various hotels, restaurants, bars, and nightclubs.
sources.shortName: The Best Attractions and Things To Do in Antalya

places.name: Konyaaltƒ± Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful pebble beach. There's watersport and other activities available there at the beach starting from 950TL per activity. There's a lift to access the beach if you don't want to walk all the way down.

The beach is very nice and very long. there are different activities on the gardens behind the beach where you can play tennis, football, skating and basketball. also there are places for walking your dogs. Also, there are lots of caf√©s and restaurants. I think you can do everything in this place, so there are places for cabins for changing clothes and also free toilets all over the beach I highly advise going or visiting this place. It is very nice. Also the sea water is very clear but the beach is a little bit rocky but not harmful. Also, the views are very good when you reach the end of the beach you find cliffs .  There is a lift which will take you up to the sitting area over the cliffs. you can enjoy good views from there and also enjoy sitting in cafes.

Beautiful beach area, plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from.  Bars in a strictly academic sense... There is also a liquor store, which I never seen another in the entirety of Turkey.  Great place to find food and a very nice beach, though it is not sand.  Basically all pebbles and stones.  Follow for more...

places.address: Ku≈ükavaƒüƒ±, Akdeniz Blv. No:100 07070, 07070 Bahtƒ±lƒ± K√∂y√º K√∂y√º/Konyaaltƒ±/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Konyaaltƒ± Beaches in Antalya offer a picturesque setting with crystal-clear waters and stunning surroundings, making it an ideal spot for sunbathing, swimming, and enjoying fresh seafood. The well-equipped beach provides amenities such as sun loungers, umbrellas, beach bars, and restaurants. Visitors can also partake in water sports like jet skiing and parasailing. Additionally, the area is known for its large all-inclusive hotels that boast top-notch facilities.

sources.snippet: There are countless Instagrammable spots along this stunning beach, but the absolute hotspot is undoubtedly the picture frame at the start of Konyaalti Beach. Here you can present yourself perfectly and use the impressive backdrop of the beach as a background. The picturesque view of the turquoise sea and the fine sandy beach makes this Instagram experience simply unforgettable.
sources.shortName: Antalya's Top 12 Instagram Hotspots: Capture the Beauty of Turkey 2024

sources.snippet: Konyaalti Beach is very close to the town center and one of the two main beaches in the city. The beach is pebbly therefore do not expect soft sands under your toes. Locals head to the beach after work during weekdays or on weekends with their umbrellas and sunbeds.
sources.shortName: 23 Fabulous Things to Do in Antalya, Turkey, Including The Best Day Trips!

places.name: Konyaaltƒ± Beaches

reviews.text: A local recommended this beach, and it did not disappoint! üåä‚ú® It had stunning views of the cliffed edges and ended with a breathtaking sight of the mountains. Since we visited in February, we even got to see snow on the mountain peaks, making it even more special ‚ùÑÔ∏èüèîÔ∏è. The only downside is that the sand isn't golden, but overall, it was a beautiful experience! üòä

I visited Konyaalti Beach on the morning of Saturday, May 24. The water was surprisingly warm and crystal-clear - truly inviting! There were no waves, making it absolutely perfect for swimming. The beach holds a Blue Flag certification, ensuring excellent water quality and cleanliness. The stunning Beydaƒülarƒ± Mountains in the background create a breathtaking view. With well-maintained facilities and nearby cafes, it's a fantastic spot for both relaxation and great photos. Highly recommended!

A stunning beach right in the heart of Antalya. It's popular with both locals and tourists, with plenty of beach chairs, bars, cafes, restaurants, and fast food options lining the sandy shore.

Even at 6am, the area is full of life with people swimming, paddle boarding, exercising, or just relaxing and taking in the view. There's also a lift available if you're coming from the top of the cliff or prefer not to walk down the road

sources.snippet: The deep blue hues of the Mediterranean are undoubtedly breathtaking, but if you really want to take your Instagram feed to the next level, head to the Duden Waterfalls in Antalya. These lush landscapes provide a fascinating backdrop for your photos. Whether you choose the Upper Duden or the Lower Duden, you will be amazed by the beautiful waterfalls in the background.
sources.shortName: Antalya's Top 12 Instagram Hotspots: Capture the Beauty of Turkey 2024

reviews.text: If you're in Antalya, this is a place you must visit. It has a unique feature where you have to crouch slightly as you walk through a cave to reach the river and the base of the waterfall. We took a bus from Kalei√ßi Old Town, which comes once every hour. The entrance ticket cost 150 TL for two people.

A fantastic place to visit. Has a small amount of entrance fee. It is easy to get there by public transport. I loved it. The only annoying thing is that tourists dump their rubbish into the water, even though there are many trash bins available.

It is a nice place. Entrance is 70 TL per person. The place is not so big. Suitable for kids under supervision. You can see the waterfalls. You can also see a cave full of bats which I found really nice to see :) You can also take a photo with Parrots (cost 300 TL per photo)
